description: Noble Architecture CSS Style Conventions — Cursor Enforcement Rules

rules.name: Align CSS Property Colons and Values
rules.description: All CSS declarations must align colons and values vertically in a column-like format using 4+ spaces.

rules.name: Use REM Units With 00.00 Format for Sizes
rules.description: Size-related values must use rem units with two digits before and after the decimal point (e.g. 01.00rem).

rules.name: Do Not Use Shorthand for Margin and Padding
rules.description: Always use explicit properties (margin-top, margin-right, etc.) instead of shorthand for spacing.

rules.name: Use CSS Variables for Colours and Text Values
rules.description: Use CSS custom properties (variables) for all colour and text-based styling. Do not hardcode hex values.

rules.name: Comment Format — /*   <-- Your comment */
rules.description: All inline comments must use the specified spacing format to align and annotate clearly.

rules.name: Use Full Section Headers at Top of Files
rules.description: All CSS files must start with a full-width header comment block detailing filename, type, and version history.

rules.name: Use Section Titles With Dividers and Version Tags
rules.description: Sections should be introduced using a title block with version history and formatted header dividers.

rules.name: Follow BEM Naming With Noble Block Format
rules.description: Class names must follow Noble’s BEM-like pattern: 4-letter UPPERCASE block, double underscore, Title Case element, and double hyphen state modifier.

rules.name: Limit Nesting to 3 Levels
rules.description: Avoid deep nesting. Selectors should use no more than 3 levels (BLOCK__Element--modifier).

rules.name: All Colour Declarations Must Use Semantic Variables
rules.description: Colours must be declared using semantic custom properties like --button-hover-bg, not literal hex or RGB.

rules.name: Use Descriptive CSS Variable Names
rules.description: CSS variable names should indicate semantic purpose (e.g. --primary-hover), not raw colour values.

rules.name: Place Media Queries at Bottom of Stylesheet
rules.description: All responsive overrides must be grouped at the end of the file using standardised breakpoints.

rules.name: Mobile Scaling Via Root Font Size
rules.description: Apply responsive scaling by increasing root font size instead of resizing individual components.

rules.name: Avoid !important Unless In Utility Classes
rules.description: Do not use !important unless explicitly required in global utilities.

rules.name: Avoid Box Shadow and Gradient Overuse
rules.description: Limit use of box-shadow and gradients. Reserve for UI focus or essential highlights only.
